page.title: 09FLEED FARM,WIVELISCOMBE (2)
page.content:
The cows calve during September, October and November. When a cow has calved, the calves start drinking milk. After the calf has been with its mother for 24 hours, it is taken away and drinks milk from a bucket.
A calf weighs about 40 to 50kg at birth. A bull calf would usually make between Â£80 to Â£100 when sold at three weeks. The heifers are weaned at about six weeks, they are reared on the farm and join the herd at two years, after calving.
Fleed Farm is 130 acres, but 30 acres is very steep ground. Fertiliser is spread on the fields every month during the summer.If there is not much rain, grass becomes rather scarce in the summer.
